Key: ―Ow!
Shido! What's wrong?!
I-I'm okay... Just sore muscles.

I see, thank goodness.
I'll bring a compress, so sit down.
All right... Sorry.
Here, it should be okay now.
Ah, thank you.

Are you okay? You were in a deep sleep, and
then you tried to go to Takadai Park...

Ah, yeah. It's just as you say...
Oh, that's right...
Rinne, have you ever gone to the top?

Huh? Um... I got lost halfway and turned back
around. Ahaha... but sometimes I think about
seeing the view from up there.

Huh, I see. I know how you feel. Being able to
look down at the entire city is... I guess it's
kinda nice.

Yeah. To be able to see what the city we live
in looks like. I like that thought.

Oh, but Rinne? It's probably best that you don't
go near there for a while.
Huh? What do you mean?
Well you see, um, it's not normal, and...

Oh, if you're talking about sore muscles, I'm
all trained up from lacrosse, so it's fine.
No, that's not what I mean...

(How do I explain it to her? The only way
to put it is that it's... strange.)

You don't have to worry, Shido. It seems like we
won't be able to go there for a while anyway.
Huh...?

We can still go to Takadai Park, but the viewing
point past it will be under reconstruction,
so it'll be off-limits for a while.
Really?!

Seems like it... Oh, there―on the news. Isn't that
what they're talking about?
Construction of the viewing platform began\nearlier today; a result of City efforts to prevent\nany accidents caused by falling off of the...
Today...?!

(It was too much of a coincidence. The TV
practically echoed what Rinne said just now.)

(The mayor of Tengu City was shown on screen
speaking to a crowd of residents in front of the
train station.)

There weren't any signs that they'd be doing
construction up there.

That's not true. They had it fenced
off and everything.
Huh? Really?

Yeah. Not as many people visit because the view's
obstructed. I guess the view itself will change
from now on.

You should watch local news once in a while. They
talk about some pretty important things that end
up being useful information.
Yeah, you're right. I'll be careful from now on.

But it's kind of a shame that we can't go up
there... Yesterday you wanted to take Tohka there,
right?

Umm, yeah. I thought we could go see the
whole city together.
I see...

Well, it's not like we'll never
be able to go again...

But... If that were the case...
What would you do, Shido?
What would I do...? Would that even be possible?

Hehe, I'm just kidding. I'm sure there's no way
that would happen.
Yeah...
